alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 8:17PM EDT until May 03 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Strafford and Rockingham Counties. For the Lamprey River...including Newmarket...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lamprey River near Newmarket. * WHEN...From tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 8.0 feet. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
